Experimental information

For the dose-response relationship, each dot indicates drug response at different dosages, and each color represents the original datasets. A pink line is an integrated dose-response curve. Grey lines represent alternative dose-response curves resulting from a Bayesian curve fitting. A horizontal dashed line represents 50% cell inhibitions. A vertical dashed line represents ????.


  • IC50 indicates how much drug dosage is needed to inhibit the cells by 50%, in vitro, compared to the control well.
  • IC90 indicates how much drug dosage is needed to inhibit the cells by 90%, in vitro, compared to the control well.
  • AUC represents the area under a dose-response curve, where 0% indicates no activity and 100% indicates that a drug completely inhibits the cells across testing dosages.
  • EC50 indicates half-maximal effective dosage, which induces a response halfway between the baseline and maximum inhibition.
  • Einf indicates the response at the highest drug dosage tested.

Dose-response curve fitting

Obtaining response information at different dosage
  • CCLE
    • dosage = dosage
    response = response × -0.01

  • GDSC1, GDSC2
    • neg control = NC-0
    Pos control = B
    dosage = conic
    response = (neg_val-intensity) ÷ (neg_val-pos_val)

  • CTRP1, CTRP2
    • response = 1- cpd_avg_pv
    dosage = cpd_conc_umol

A Bayesian curve fitting
  • Logistic equation and parameter description
    • \[f(x) = \displaystyle\frac{1}{2^{-k(x-a)}}\]
  • We used JAGS to estimate a dose-response curve for each cell line. Initial parameters:

    • Parameter Value Note
    n iter 5000 ...
    burn in 500 ...
    n chain 3 ...
    k_priors dnorm(2 , 0.01) ...
    k_lambda_priors dnorm(1 , 0.01) ...
    nu_priors dnorm(250 , 0.001) ...
    sigma_priors dunif(0.01 , 0.1) ...
    k dgamma(k_lambda_prior, k_prior) ...
    a_mu dnorm(0 , 1) ...
    a_sigma dunif(0.01 , 5) ...
    a dnorm(a_mu , \((\frac{1}{a\_sigma})^2\) ...
    f(x) dt( \(\frac{1}{2^{-k(x-a)}}\) , \((\frac{1}{sigma\_priors})^2\) , nu_priors) ...
